definitions.definition: An endowment for the maintenance of a priest to sing a daily mass for the souls of specified people
A chapel set up for this purpose
Unattractive, ugly
A female bird in the condition to incubate eggs; a broody hen, duck, etc.
definitions.example: There are six broodies in that coop.

definitions.definition: Of birds: sitting persistently and protectively on a nest, in order to hatch eggs.
definitions.example: a broody hen

definitions.definition: Of any creature or person: showing an interest in raising young.
A proving flight; usually of a prototype of a new aircraft design before it goes into production.
A loose robe or outer garment worn historically by men in Arab or Middle Eastern countries.
A sleeveless garment that buttons down the front, worn over a shirt, and often as part of a suit; a waistcoat.
A sleeveless garment, often with a low-cut neck, usually worn under a shirt or blouse.
A sleeveless top, typically with identifying colours or logos, worn by an athlete or member of a sports team.
Any sleeveless outer garment, often for a purpose such as identification, safety, or storage.
A vestment.
Clothing generally; array; garb.
To clothe with, or as with, a vestment, or garment; to dress; to robe; to cover, surround, or encompass closely.
To clothe with authority, power, etc.; to put in possession; to invest; to furnish; to endow; followed by with and the thing conferred.
definitions.example: to vest a court with power to try cases of life and death

definitions.definition: To place or give into the possession or discretion of some person or authority; to commit to another; with in before the possessor.
definitions.example: The power of life and death is vested in the king, or in the courts.

definitions.definition: To invest; to put.
definitions.example: to vest money in goods, land, or houses

definitions.definition: To clothe with possession; also, to give a person an immediate fixed right of present or future enjoyment of.
definitions.example: an estate is vested in possession

definitions.definition: (of an inheritance or a trust fund) To devolve upon the person currently entitled when a prior interest has ended.
definitions.example: Upon the death of the Sovereign the Crown automatically vests in the next heir without the need of coronation or other formality.

definitions.definition: (financial) To become vested, to become permanent.
definitions.example: My pension vests at the end of the month and then I can take it with me when I quit.

definitions.definition: A situation in which road traffic accumulates until it is stationary or very slow.
A squirrel’s nest, built of twigs in a tree.
A possum’s nest, built of twigs and leaves in a tree.
A percussion instrument used in southern Indian music, consisting of a two-sided drum whose body is usually made from a hollowed piece of jackfruit wood.
Lacking in beauty or elegance, plain in appearance, physically unattractive.
Cozy, befitting a home.
Characteristic of or belonging to home; domestic.
On intimate or friendly terms with (someone); familiar; at home (with a person); intimate.
(of animals) Domestic; tame.
Personal; private.
Friendly; kind; gracious; cordial.
Conservative and family-oriented.
definitions.example: I am seeking a beautiful homely girl for marriage.

definitions.definition: Simple; plain; familiar; unelaborate; unadorned.
definitions.example: a homely garment

definitions.definition: An individual's amorous or sexual relationships.
An elaborately-layered ice cream sundae served in a tall glass.
The cuff of a sleeve that wraps around the wrist
A strip of material worn around the wrist, e.g. to absorb perspiration, especially in sports
A band that supports a wristwatch
A cord worn around the wrist, used to hold a small object such as a knife: a lanyard
The quality or state of being in good health.
The process of learning about and engaging in behaviors that are likely to result in optimal health.
Redundancy affording mutual backup in the event of one system failing.
definitions.example: He believes in belt and braces, booking flights from two different airports on different airlines for important trips.

definitions.definition: An SI unit of mass, equivalent to one thousandth of a gram. Symbol: mg
A steroid hormone, produced by the adrenal cortex, that regulates the metabolism of carbohydrates and maintains blood pressure.
A synthetic version of this hormone used to treat Addison's disease and other conditions.
Overly confident; arrogant and boastful.
Used as a term of endearment, originally for a person of either sex, but later primarily for a man.
A (familiar name for a) cockatoo.
Short for cockatoo farmer; (by extension) any farmer or owner of rural land.
To operate a small-scale farm.
Friendly; kind; sweet; gracious
definitions.example: amiable ideas

definitions.definition: Of a pleasant and likeable nature; kind-hearted; easy to like
definitions.example: an amiable person

definitions.definition: A lean breed of dog used in hunting and racing.
A highball cocktail of vodka and grapefruit juice.
A swift steamer, especially an ocean steamer.
(of fish) To leap rapidly across the surface of the water.
A foot soldier armed with a musket.
In 17th- and 18th-century France, a member of the royal household bodyguard.
A comrade or fellow.
To put (someone or something) in danger; to risk causing harm to.
To incur the hazard of; to risk; to run the risk of.
In danger, at risk, said of something where there is a strong possibility something bad will happen to it (for example, a species in danger of going extinct)
The legal process of verifying the legality of a will.
A copy of a legally recognised and qualified will.
Proof
To establish the legality of (a will).
A court (tribunal) whose function is to administer estates (property of a decedent) and prove wills
A contributor to a blog (from weblog) or online journal.
The thin layer of cells at the back of the eyeball where light is converted into neural signals sent to the brain.
Neutrality towards all religions.
definitions.example: state secularism

definitions.definition: The political belief in the separation of church and state, i.e. the position that religious belief should not influence public and governmental decisions.
Any of various beetles of the family Anobiidae, especially Xestobium rufovillosum, that bore into wood and make a tapping sound.
On a multilane road, the lane intended or reserved for vehicles moving at faster speeds.
(by extension) Any situation or activity where the pace is very rapid.
A house or place in which a person lives; a habitation, a home.
definitions.example: The old house served as a dwelling for Albert.

definitions.definition: To live; to reside.
To linger (on) a particular thought, idea etc.; to remain fixated (on).
To be in a given state.
To abide; to remain; to continue.
To inspect; to examine.
definitions.example: Check the oil in your car once a month.

definitions.definition: To verify the accuracy of a text or translation, usually making some corrections (proofread) or many (copyedit).

(often used with "off") To mark items on a list (with a checkmark or by crossing them out) that have been chosen for keeping or removal or that have been dealt with (for example, completed or verified as correct or satisfactory).
definitions.example: Check off the items that you've checked (inspected).

definitions.definition: To control, limit, or halt.
definitions.example: Check your enthusiasm during a negotiation.

definitions.definition: To verify or compare with a source of information.
definitions.example: Check your data against known values.

definitions.definition: To leave in safekeeping.
definitions.example: Check your hat and coat at the door.

definitions.definition: To leave with a shipping agent for shipping.
definitions.example: Check your bags at the ticket counter before the flight.

definitions.definition: To pass or bounce the ball to an opponent from behind the three-point line and have the opponent pass or bounce it back to start play.
definitions.example: He checked the ball and then proceeded to perform a perfect layup.

definitions.definition: To disrupt another player with the stick or body to obtain possession of the ball or puck.
definitions.example: The hockey player checked the defenceman to obtain the puck.

definitions.definition: To remain in a hand without betting. Only legal if no one has yet bet.
definitions.example: Tom didn't think he could win, so he checked.

definitions.definition: To make a move which puts an adversary's king in check; to put in check.
To chide, rebuke, or reprove.
To slack or ease off, as a brace which is too stiffly extended.
To crack or gape open, as wood in drying; or to crack in small checks, as varnish, paint, etc.
To make checks or chinks in; to cause to crack.
definitions.example: The sun checks timber.

definitions.definition: To make a stop; to pause; with at.
To clash or interfere.
To act as a curb or restraint.
To turn, when in pursuit of proper game, and fly after other birds.
To mark with a check pattern.
Having a pattern of checks; checkered.
definitions.example: a checked tie

definitions.definition: Of syllables, having a coda.
Of consonants, glottalized.
Verified or validated in some way.
definitions.example: a computer program using checked arithmetic

definitions.definition: A small book for keeping other people's addresses and phone numbers.
A computerized storage area for contact information such as e-mail addresses.
Experiencing or causing nausea or uneasiness, often characterized by an unsettled stomach.
Easily troubled; squeamish.
The act of enrolling or the state of being enrolled.
The people enrolled, considered as a group.
The number of people enrolled.
The record of such enrolling; registration.
Behaving oddly, or as though in distress, due to being overcome by feelings of love.
Having an aching desire for one's beloved.
To carve text or symbols into (something), usually for the purposes of identification or art.
definitions.example: He engraved the plaque with his name.

definitions.definition: To carve (something) into a material.
definitions.example: He engraved his name.

definitions.definition: To put in a grave, to bury.
The practice of incising a design onto a hard, flat surface, by cutting grooves into it.
The art of producing an image from an engraved printing form, typically made of copper.
A print produced from an engraving.
The art of drawing music notation at high quality, particularly on a computer.
In tatters, having the texture broken.
definitions.example: a ragged coat

definitions.definition: Having rough edges; jagged or uneven
definitions.example: ragged rocks

definitions.definition: Harsh-sounding; having an unpleasant noise
Wearing tattered clothes.
definitions.example: a ragged fellow

definitions.definition: Rough; shaggy; rugged.
Faulty; lacking in skill, reliability, or organization.
Performed in a syncopated manner, especially in ragtime.
Of a data structure: having uneven levels.
definitions.example: a ragged hierarchy

definitions.definition: To decorate (a wall, etc.) by applying paint with a rag.
To become tattered.
To break (ore) into lumps for sorting.
To cut or dress roughly, as a grindstone.
To scold or tell off; to torment; to banter.
To drive a car or another vehicle in a hard, fast or unsympathetic manner.
To tease or torment, especially at a university; to bully, to haze.
To play or compose (a piece, melody, etc.) in syncopated time.
To dance to ragtime music.
To add syncopation (to a tune) and thereby make it appropriate for a ragtime song.
A female peafowl.
Resembling silver in color, shiny white.
Sprinkled or covered with silver.
Having the clear, musical tone of silver; soft and clear in sound.
definitions.example: a silvery laugh

definitions.definition: To break a strike; to work for a business where the union members are on strike.
Activity intended to disrupt or end without an agreement a strike by workers.
A woman or girl, especially of low status.
An effeminate male, a male homosexual.
Pure MDMA powder.
A mollemoke.
A female cat, a she-cat (usually spayed)
A bird, the wagtail.
A molly bolt.
To engage in (male) homosexual activity with.
A fish of the genus Poecilia, except for those known as guppies.
In a legitimate manner, properly.
(on a square-rigged ship) The lowest (and usually the largest) square sail hung on the foremast
A square fore-and-aft sail set on the foremast, but behind it, on a schooner or other similar vessel.
(on a sloop) A triangular sail set forward of the foremast: forestaysail.
Capable of functioning on land or in water.
Occurring on both land and water.
definitions.example: an amphibious attack

definitions.definition: The collision of one or more cars
(by extension) A mess or disaster, especially one that attracts a lot of attention.
A sailing ship with two or more masts, all with fore-and-aft sails; if two masted, having a foremast and a mainmast.
A glass of beer, of a size which varies between states (Wikipedia).
A large goblet or drinking glass, used for lager or ale (Wikipedia).
A covered wagon used by emigrants.
Extremely angry; furious to the point of outburst.
definitions.example: He was hopping mad when he came home and discovered that she had bought a new car without consulting him.

definitions.definition: A buddy film.
The act of disapproving; condemnation.
One who, or that which, backs; especially one who backs an entrant in a contest, or who supports an enterprise by funding it.
A device that circulates fresh air and expels stale or noxious air.
A machine that moves breathable air into and out of the lungs of a patient who is unable to breathe sufficiently.
A play or an actor so bad as to empty the theater.
The status or term of office of a pontiff or pontifex.
To preside as a bishop, especially at mass.
To act like a pontiff; to express one's position or opinions dogmatically and pompously as if they were absolutely correct.
To speak in a patronizing, supercilious or pompous manner, especially at length.
Any of various deciduous trees or shrubs in the genus Salix, in the willow family Salicaceae, found primarily on moist soils in cooler zones in the northern hemisphere.
The wood of these trees.
A cricket bat.
(1800s) The baseball bat.
A rotating spiked drum used to open and clean cotton heads.
To open and cleanse (cotton, flax, wool, etc.) by means of a willow.
To form a shape or move in a way similar to the long, slender branches of a willow.
Someone, especially a romantic partner, with whom one is exceptionally or uniquely compatible or has a special, almost spiritual connection.
A man who is the head of a household, family or tribe.
To detest, hate, revile.
definitions.example: I absolutely loathe this place.

definitions.definition: Any of the seven bones of the tarsus.
Of or relating to the tarsus.
A sufferer from poliomyelitis.
Acute infection by the poliovirus, especially of the motor neurons in the spinal cord and brainstem, leading to muscle weakness, paralysis and sometimes deformity.
A reproductive organism (especially such as in an insect).
Of or relating to reproduction.
That reproduces.
Tournament.
To take part in a tournament.
To adjust so as to align with or place at a right angle to something else; in particular:
definitions.example: The casting was mounted on a milling machine so that its sides could be squared.

definitions.definition: To resolve or reconcile; to suit or fit.
definitions.example: John can square this question up for us.

definitions.definition: To adjust or adapt so as to bring into harmony with something.
definitions.example: I cannot square the results of the experiment with my hypothesis.

definitions.definition: Of a value, term or expression, to multiply by itself; to raise to the second power.
To draw, with a pair of compasses and a straightedge only, a square with the same area as.
definitions.example: square the circle

definitions.definition: To make a short low pass sideways across the pitch
To take opposing sides; to quarrel.
To accord or agree exactly; to be consistent with; to suit; to fit.
To go to opposite sides; to take an attitude of offense or defense, or of defiance; to quarrel.
To take a boxing attitude; often with up or off.
To form with four sides and four right angles.
To form with right angles and straight lines, or flat surfaces.
definitions.example: to square mason's work

definitions.definition: To compare with, or reduce to, any given measure or standard.
To hold a quartile position respecting.
Covered with a grid of squares.
Raised to the second power.
An element of an educational curriculum concerned with bodily development, physical health and wellness, strength, physical co-ordination, and agility.
To wish for or desire (something); to feel a need or desire for; to crave or demand.
definitions.example: What do you want to eat?  I want you to leave.  I never wanted to go back to live with my mother.

definitions.definition: (in particular) To wish, desire or demand to see, have the presence of or do business with.
definitions.example: Danish police want him for embezzlement.

definitions.definition: To desire (to experience desire); to wish.
definitions.example: You can leave if you want.

definitions.definition: (usually second person, often future tense) To be advised to do something (compare should, ought).
definitions.example: You’ll want to repeat this three or four times to get the best result.

definitions.definition: (now colloquial) To lack and be in need of or require (something, such as a noun or verbal noun).
definitions.example: That chair wants fixing.

definitions.definition: (now rare) To have occasion for (something requisite or useful); to require or need.
To be lacking or deficient or absent.
definitions.example: There was something wanting in the play.

definitions.definition: To be in a state of destitution; to be needy; to lack.
definitions.example: The paupers desperately want.

definitions.definition: To lack and be without, to not have (something).
definitions.example: She wanted anything she needed.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To lack and (be able to) do without.
Wished for; desired; sought
Subject to immediate detainment by law enforcement authorities on sight.
A person who learns from another, especially one who then teaches others.
An active follower or adherent of someone, or some philosophy etc.
A wretched, miserable-looking man.
To convert (a person) into a disciple.
To train, educate, teach.
The quality or state of being plural, or in the plural number.
The state of a pluralist; the holding of more than one ecclesiastical living at a time.
A social system that permits smaller groups within a society to maintain their individual cultural identities.
The belief that there should be diverse and competing centers of power in society.
The acknowledgement of a diversity of political systems.
The existence of differing legal systems in a population or area.
The belief that values can be simultaneously antagonistic and incommensurable.
Susceptible to twitching a lot.
Irritable, cranky
The state of being uncivil; lack of courtesy; rudeness in manner.
Any act of rudeness or ill-breeding.
Want of civilization; a state of rudeness or barbarism.
A private house in which paying residents are provided with accommodation and meals.
A boarding school building where boarders live during term time.
One of a pair of elongated pointed teeth that extend outside the mouth of an animal such as walrus, elephant or wild boar.
definitions.example: Until the CITES sales ban, elephant tusks were the 'backbone' of the legal ivory trade.

definitions.definition: A small projection on a (tusk) tenon.
A tusk shell.
A projecting member like a tenon, and serving the same or a similar purpose, but composed of several steps, or offsets, called teeth.
A sharp point.
The share of a plough.
To dig up using a tusk, as boars do.
To gore with the tusks.
To bare or gnash the teeth.
A fish, the torsk (Brosme brosme).
An event or enterprise that ends suddenly and disastrously, often with humiliating consequences.
A breaking up of a natural dam, usually made of ice, by a river and the ensuing rush of water.
A member of the clergy.
Of or relating to clerks or their work.
Of or relating to the clergy.
One who handles something (especially manually) or someone.
definitions.example: The handler of a weapon gets a symbolic sensation of deadly power.

definitions.definition: (in combination) A controller, trainer, someone who handles a specified thing, animal or person (especially a prizefighter).
definitions.example: The spy's handler told him to approach the subject by posing as a dog handler.

definitions.definition: An advisor or manager to a person occupying a position or office to which the speaker believes the holder does not possess the typical qualifications and/or experience.
A subroutine that handles a particular situation such as an event or exception.
The line that bounds a circle or other two-dimensional figure
The length of such a line
The surface of a round or spherical object
The length of the longest cycle of a graph
To include in a circular space; to bound.
A simple musical instrument (membranophone) consisting of a pipe with a hole in it, producing a buzzing sound when the player hums into it.
To play the kazoo.
A ball of dough that is cooked and may have a filling and/or additional ingredients in the dough.
(familiar) A term of endearment.
definitions.example: My little dumpling.

definitions.definition: (mildly) A piece of excrement.

Present participle of gaslight: the act of manipulating someone psychologically such that they question their own memory, perception, and sanity, thereby evoking in them cognitive dissonance and low self-esteem.
To manipulate (someone) psychologically such that they question their own memory, perception, and sanity, thereby evoking in them cognitive dissonance and low self-esteem.
A state of enjoyable exuberance
Playful fun
Tongs, usually electrically heated, used for curling or waving the hair.
A thin brush for applying paint.
The holding of two contradictory beliefs in one's mind simultaneously and accepting both of them as true or correct, without realizing the contradiction.
A fashionably elegant person.
definitions.example: He's such a swank.

definitions.definition: Ostentation; bravado.
definitions.example: The parvenu was full of swank.

definitions.definition: To swagger, to show off.
definitions.example: Looks like she's going to swank in, flashing her diamonds, then swank out to another party.

definitions.definition: Fashionably elegant, posh.
A viscous preparation of oils and/or fats, usually containing medication, used as a treatment or as an emollient.
A substance used to anoint, as in religious rituals.
A type of pasta in the form of short tubes; sometimes loosely, pasta in general.
A fop, a dandy; especially a young man in the 18th century who had travelled in Europe and who dressed and often spoke in an ostentatiously affected Continental manner.
A person who is authorized to supervise, direct or administer something.
A police rank used in Commonwealth countries, ranking above chief inspector, and below chief superintendent.

The manager of a building, usually a communal residence, who is responsible for keeping the facilities functional and often collecting rent or similar payments, either as also the building's landlord or on behalf of same. Often abbreviated "super".
The head of a Sunday school.
In some Protestant churches, a clergyman having the oversight of the clergy of a district.
A janitor.
Overseeing; superintending.
(grammar) In some Indo-European languages, a prefix e- (a- in Sanskrit) indicating a past tense of a verb.
(grammar) In some Bantu languages, an additional vowel prepended to the noun prefix.
An increase.
To increase; to make larger or supplement.
definitions.example: The money from renting out a spare room can augment a salary.

definitions.definition: To grow; to increase; to become greater.
To slow the tempo or meter, e.g. for a dramatic or stately passage.
To increase an interval, especially the largest interval in a triad, by a half step (chromatic semitone).
(grammar) To add an augment to.
Any cheese produced by taking goat milk and using the process to make cheese.
Molecules, such as amino acids, sugars, nucleic acids, proteins, polysaccharides, DNA, and RNA, that occur naturally in living organisms
An enclosed railroad freight car, especially one with a sliding door.
To reduce to a boxcar function.
A room, group of rooms, or other space where works of art are placed on display, possibly for sale.
(manner) In a secure manner; without fear or apprehension; without danger
